name: 葉采青
objective:
十八世紀小說的興起讓文學歷史進入了一個新的時代。有別於以往的文學作品與作家，十八世紀小說家以更"寫實"的角度表達他們對於社會的關懷。本課程旨在探討十八世紀小說文類的發展，並以Daniel Defoe, Eliza Haywood, Henry Fielding以及Samuel Richardson等重要小說家的作品為探討重心，除了文本的研究之外，並輔以理論解析，以期幫助學生對於寫實小說之起源有更深入的了解。
本課程將閱讀的文類包含小說、散文以及政論小冊，在文本閱讀以外，促使十八世紀小說興起的文化背景亦會是課程重點之一。
scorePolicy:
Attendance and participation: 10%　　
Presentation: 20%
Critique: 30%
Final paper: 40%
materials:
1. Novels:
Roxana: The Fortunate Mistress. (Daniel Defoe)
The Masqueraders, or Fatal Curiosity, and The Surprize, or Constancy Rewarded. (Eliza Haywood).
Pamela: Or, Virtue Rewarded. (Samuel Richardson.)
An Apology for the Life of Mrs. Shamela Andrews. (Henry Fielding)

2. Theories:
Armstrong, Nancy. Desire and Domestic Fiction: A Political History of the Novel. New York: Oxford UP, 1987.
Eagleton, Terry. The Rape of Clarissa: Writing, sexuality and Class Struggle in Samuel Richardson. Minneapolis: U of Minnesota P, 1982.
Greene Donald. The Age of Exuberance: Backgrounds to Eighteenth-Century English Literature. New York: Random House, 1970.
Hunter, J. Paul. Before Novels: The Cultural Contexts of Eighteenth-Century English Fiction. New York: Norton, 1990.
Karl, Frederick R. A Reader’s Guide to the Development of the English Novel in the Eighteenth-Century. London: Thames and Hudson, 1974.
Sambrook, James. The Eighteenth Century: The Intellectual and Cultural Context of English Literature, 1700-1789. London: Longman, 1990.
Watt, Ian. The Rise of the Novel: Studies in Defoe, Richardson and Fielding.
